paper_abstract: TO IMPROVE SIMULATION EFFICIENCY AND RELIEVE BURDENED BENCHMARKING EFFORTS, THIS RESEARCH PROPOSES A SURVIVAL-OF-THE-FITTEST EVOLUTIONARY METHODOLOGY. THE GOAL IS TO SUBSET ANY GIVEN BENCHMARK SUITE BASED ON ITS INHERENT WORKLOAD CHARACTERISTICS, DESIRED WORKLOAD SPACE COVERAGE, AND TOTAL EXECUTION TIME. GIVEN A USER-SPECIFIED WORKLOAD SPACE COVERAGE THRESHOLD, THE PROPOSED TECHNIQUE CAN SYSTEMATICALLY YIELD THE "FITTEST'' TIME-EFFICIENT BENCHMARK SUBSET.
